title.narrative: Support to COVID-19 Vaccine Purchase and Health System Strengthening

description.narrative: This Project’s Development Objective is to support the Government of the Union of Comoros to acquire and deploy COVID-19 vaccines, to strengthen national systems for public health preparedness

participating-org.narrative: Government of the Union of Comoros

condition.narrative: Schedule II, Section 1, A, 2, (e): Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, the senior accountant, accountant, andthe internal auditor referred to in sub-paragraph (c) of this paragraph shall have been recruited and appointed.

Schedule II, Section 1, A, 2, (f): Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date the deputy coordinator, the procurementspecialist, the monitoring and evaluation specialist, the social mobilization specialist, the two social and environmentalassistants, and the environmental specialist referred to in sub-paragraph (c) of this paragraph shall have been recruited andappointed.

Schedule II, Section 1, A, 2, (g): Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, an external auditor shall have beenrecruited and appointed recruited on the basis of terms of reference, qualifications, integrity and experience acceptable to theAssociation.

Schedule II, Section 1, B, 2, (a): by no later than two (2) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budgetfor Project implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable; and (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity.

title.narrative: Percentage of frontline health care workers with the knowledge to recognize, medically manage, and refer GBV survivors to appropriate services
Number of public health facilities reporting data in the DHIS2
Number of health centers equipped with solar power to deliver health services
Number of health facilities and national/regional stores rehabilitated with resilient infrastructure and solarized
Number of sites for which requested cold chain equipment have been installed and are functional
Number of coordination units that are functional
Number of eligible COVID-19 vaccine doses procured and available in country
Percentage of female health workers with the knowledge to recognize, medically manage, and refer GBV survivors to appropriate services
Percentage of grievances addressed within 2 weeks of initial complaint being recorded
Completion rate of communication activities for demand generation and acceptance of the COVID-19 vaccine
Proportion of adverse events following immunization (AEFI) reported and investigated based on national guidelines
Number of villages implementing citizen engagement initiatives on COVID-19 vaccination and prevention measures
Percentage of the population fully vaccinated, based on prioritized populations as defined in national plan, by gender
Percentage of females fully vaccinated, based on the prioritized population in the national plan
Percentage of females who received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine
Percentage of the population who received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, by gender
The e-vaccination tool is integrated in the DHIS2 for COVID-19 vaccination monitoring
